title: Muscle car typeface
content:
Hello all,

I'm looking for a typeface to use on a 70's muscle car inspired invitation. The invite will feature an illustration of a muscle car (Valiant Charger) and a cliched hot girl (think Daisy Duke).

Any suggestions on a typeface that might complement this illustration?

Cheers
author: roboah

comments.content: Letterhead Fonts has a section dedicated to [racing](http://web.archive.org/web/20120512002957/http:/letterheadfonts.com/styles/racing.shtml).
House Industries would also be a good place to look.
First thing that came in my mind was [Accelerator](http://web.archive.org/web/20120512002957/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/characters/accelerator/) from René Verkaart.

I think [Font Diner](http://web.archive.org/web/20120512002957/http:/www.fontdiner.com/main.html) might be a good place to look also. They have loads of great retro fonts.

Sharon

I just did a book on Muscle Cars! That is so funny. The client didn't want to go kitsch so I used Eurostile and Century Old Style.

House Industries definitely had some fun ones, particularly Global. I also looked at Magneto.

Sorry! I meant Bullet! Don't know where I got Global. Brain freeze from the iced coffee I just drank perhaps.

[http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=8&subpage=viewfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20120512002957/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=8&subpage=viewfonts "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=8&subpage=viewfonts")
Ehehe. Bullet would be a great choice for a muscle car.
Bullet was named Global when it was first released.
Interesting factoid. Patty you've been redeemed! ;^)
